definition: to be quite an ordeal/to be hard to bear
enough (sufficient)/enough (too much)/(coll.) (before adj.) really/(coll.) to reach by stretching out
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)

sentences.english: This place has an odious smell; something must be rotten.
sentences.chinese: 這腐爛的肉聞一下就夠受的了。

sentences.english: She had a really bad fall.
sentences.chinese: 她這一跤摔得真夠受的。

sentences.english: But it was a long hour for me.
sentences.chinese: 可是，這一個小時我夠受的。

sentences.english: It is enough for me to recall the flogging of peasants.
sentences.chinese: 只要回憶起農民被鞭笞的事就叫我夠受的了。

sentences.english: After three games, I'd had enough.
sentences.chinese: 三局打下來後，我已夠受的了。
